column4: try use a different font, the microsoft ones show up like that for me too.  But if I set preferences to use my own fonts (bitstream vera sans I think) it looks good
s/use/using
the weird thing is that firefox uses the same fonts on both my machines and one looks perfect, the ohter looks crap
are you sure the other machine has the microsoft fonts installed?  If you don't install them, then the machine defaults to what it can find
er.. don't know.. let me look
i don't think i have ms fonts installed..
on the machine with the bad firefox fonts you mean?
yeah

set preferences > content > fonts > advanced to always use your own fonts, and see if that fixes it.  That should at least tell you if it is a font selection problem.  You could also check the antialias settings in system > preferences > fonts
if i tell it always to use my fonts it looks fine
that is what I do, I don't know if there is a way to make the other fonts look smoother
texinfo

err right click..
in nautilus
